results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Organized Crime;Zottola, Anthony;Zottola, Salvatore;Zottola, Sylvester;Shelton, Bushawn;Cosa Nostra;Bronx (NYC)
results.title: A Mobster Dodged Hit After Hit. His Son Finally Got Him.
results.abstract: Anthony Zottola was convicted of murder-for-hire Wednesday. Prosecutors say he wanted the real estate business of his father, Sylvester, a reputed Bonnano crime family associate.

media.caption: Police investigate the McDonald’s drive-through where Sylvester Zottola died in 2018.
media.copyright: Gregg Vigliotti for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Raffensperger, Brad;Trump, Donald J;Loeffler, Kelly L;Georgia
results.byline: By Danny Hakim and Richard Fausset
results.title: Text Message Slammed Georgia Senator for Questioning Election Results
results.abstract: The wife of Georgia’s secretary of state rebuked Kelly Loeffler, then a senator, after Ms. Loeffler said the secretary had mismanaged the 2020 election.

media.caption: Brad and Tricia Raffensperger arrived at his election night party in John’s Creek, Ga., in May.
media.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Kherson (Ukraine);Luhansk (Ukraine);Donbas (Ukraine);Russia
results.title: U.S. Sees Opportunity for Ukraine to Capitalize on Russian Weakness
results.abstract: The next six weeks, before fall mud spreads, could allow Ukraine’s military to press forward in the Donbas and potentially retake Kherson, American officials said. But Russia may not be deterred.

media.caption: Military analysts say that Ukrainian forces have momentum on their side.
media.copyright: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Student Loans;Decisions and Verdicts;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Barrett, Amy Coney;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Congressional Budget Office;Supreme Court (US);Wisconsin
results.title: Courts Reject Challenges to Biden Plan on Student Debt
results.abstract: A federal judge ruled that six states lacked standing to block the program, and Justice Amy Coney Barrett indicated the same thing about a taxpayers’ association.

media.caption: President Biden and Education Secretary Miguel A. Cardona giving an update on applying for student debt relief. More than 12 million people have applied for debt cancellation.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: Berlusconi, Caught on Tape Gushing Over Putin, Heightens Anxiety About Italy
results.abstract: Silvio Berlusconi, the former Italian leader and linchpin of the incoming right-wing government, blames Ukraine’s president for pushing President Vladimir V. Putin to invade.

media.caption: The billionaire media mogul Silvio Berlusconi at a rally for his right-wing alliance last month in Rome.
media.copyright: Gianni Cipriano for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Fatalities);Traffic Accidents and Safety;Diplomatic Immunity;Suits and Litigation (Civil);United States International Relations;International Relations;Dunn, Harry (d 2019);Sacoolas, Anne;British Broadcasting Corp;State Department;England;Great Britain
results.title: American Woman Pleads Guilty in Death of British Teenager
results.abstract: Anne Sacoolas pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of Harry Dunn, a 19-year-old British motorcyclist, in 2019, when she was a State Department employee in England.

media.caption: Members of Harry Dunn’s family arriving for a court hearing in London on Thursday. An American, Anne Sacoolas, pleaded guilty to causing Mr. Dunn’s death.

results.adx_keywords: James Webb Space Telescope;Stars and Galaxies;Hubble Space Telescope;Space and Astronomy;National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.title: Webb Telescope Captures New View of ‘Pillars of Creation’
results.abstract: The NASA space observatory’s infrared eye finds out what’s going on within the cloudy cosmic nursery.

media.caption: “Pillars of Creation” captured in NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope’s near-infrared view. The pillars resemble arches and spires rising from a desert, but are filled with semitransparent gas and dust.

results.adx_keywords: Tax Credits, Deductions and Exemptions;Labor and Jobs;Health Insurance and Managed Care;Income Tax;Content Type: Service;Medicare;Wages and Salaries;Pensions and Retirement Plans;Personal Finances;Social Security (US);Payroll Tax;Inflation (Economics);Internal Revenue Service
results.title: Your Paycheck Next Year Will Be Affected by Inflation. Here’s How.
results.abstract: If you get a raise, you may not end up in a higher tax bracket. But more of your income may be subject to Social Security taxes. And you’ll probably pay more for health care.

media.caption: Food inflation in the United States has remained stubbornly high this year.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Playoff Games;Wood and Wood Products;Sporting Goods and Equipment;Bonds, Barry;Longoria, Evan;Hillerich & Bradsby Co;Louisville Slugger
results.title: Baseball History Is No Longer Written With Ash Bats
results.abstract: Invasive insects and batter preferences have led to the elimination of the wood that dominated the sport for generations. There may not be a single ash bat used in this postseason.

media.caption: Babe Ruth was known for swinging an extra-large ash bat in his years of domination with the Yankees.

results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Alan Feuer
results.title: Judge Says Trump Signed Statement With Data His Lawyers Told Him Was False
results.abstract: The determination came in a decision by a federal judge that John Eastman, a lawyer for the former president, had to turn more of his emails over to the House Jan. 6 committee.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The House committee investigating Jan. 6 views John Eastman as the intellectual architect of plans to subvert the 2020 election.

results.title: Hurricane Ian Is Blamed for Deadly Bacterial Infections in Florida
results.abstract: An estimated seven people have died from Vibrio vulnificus. The infection can lead to necrotizing fasciitis, when the tissue around a wound dies, sometimes referred to as “flesh-eating bacteria.”
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Debris and destruction at Fort Myers Beach after Hurricane Ian devastated parts of Florida.
media.copyright: Johnny Milano for The New York Times

results.title: A Rare Gem in a City That Has Struggled

results.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle
results.title: Liz Truss Fires Home Secretary Hours After Being Jeered in U.K. Parliament
results.abstract: Britain’s prime minister dismissed Suella Braverman after an email breach. Ms. Truss was also grilled in Parliament over her repudiated budget.

media.caption: Prime Minister Liz Truss of Britain said she would guarantee a pension increase that her finance chief had called into question.

results.title: The Yankees Have No Answer for an Ageless Astros Ace
results.abstract: Justin Verlander struck out 11 batters and Houston beat up on the Yankees’ bullpen in a convincing Game 1 victory.

media.caption: Houston’s Justin Verlander allowed one run in six innings of work. He struck out 11 and walked one.
media.copyright: Annie Mulligan for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;United States Politics and Government;Polls and Public Opinion;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party
results.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Katie Glueck and Lisa Lerer
results.title: With Crucial Elections Looming, Biden Breaks Tradition of Big Campaign Rallies
results.abstract: President Biden’s low profile on the campaign trail reflects a low approval rating that makes him unwelcome in some congressional districts and states at a pivotal moment before the midterms.

media.caption: President Biden has not held a campaign rally since before Labor Day.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Babies and Infants;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Premature Babies;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Recalls and Bans of Products;Food and Drug Administration
results.title: F.D.A. Panel Recommends Pulling Preterm Birth Drug From the Market
results.abstract: In use for 11 years, the drug Makena provided a test case of the agency’s controversial accelerated approval program. A post-market study showed the drug was not effective.

media.caption: The preterm birth drug Makena has been in use for 11 years, but the F.D.A. recommended withdrawing it from the market. The decision was widely viewed as a test of the agency’s “accelerated approval” program.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Multiple Personalities;Mental Health and Disorders;Politics and Government;Elections, Senate;Walker, Herschel;Senate;Georgia
results.title: Walker Says His Mental Illness Is Healed. Experts Say It’s Not So Simple.
results.abstract: Most patients manage dissociative identity disorder, according to experts, rather than cure it. Herschel Walker, the G.O.P. Senate candidate in Georgia, says he has “overcome” his illness.

media.caption: A watch party in Atlanta for the debate with Herschel Walker and Senator Raphael Warnock this month.
media.copyright: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times
